column4: Please use pastebin to post contents of files:  /etc/default/tftpd-hpa  /etc/dhcp3/dhcpd.conf

The dhcpd.conf file needs some changes. The range should be in same network segment as the adapter on server has.If server eth0 is 192.168.0.100 for instance, range should be something like 192.168.0.101-192.168.0.150 (example) also router entry with eth0 IP needed
I'll post mine for an example, 1 minute
My adapter is eth1 for the pxe boot and has IP 192.168.0.100    http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/59481/
i'll test it and i'll tell you if it works thanks for your help
the pxe client told me this : CLIENT IP : 192.168.0.2 MASK 0.0.0.0 DHCP IP : 169.254.10.10 but i did this : ifconfig eth0 192.168.0.100
Please pastebin your new dhcpd.conf file
i put your example in my dhcpd.conf
Did you comment out your old entries then which had 169.254.x.x entries? Seems not :)
Did you then do: sudo /etc/init.d/dhcp3-server restart ?
You may need then to make an entry in /etcnetwork/interfaces for static settings of eth0 which has proper gateway and broadcast settings
